snippet: The Obama administration, reeling from decisions by the Supreme Court, is weighing options to provide contraceptive coverage to women who are about to lose it or never had it because of their employers’ religious objections.
abstract: Obama administration, reeling from two decisions by the Supreme Court, is weighing options to provide contraceptive coverage to women who are about to lose it or never had it because of their employers’ religious objections; White House must move fast, as experts expect rush to court involving scores of employers seeking to take advantage of decisions.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ADAM LIPTAK

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration, reeling from decisions by the Supreme Court, is weighing options to provide contraceptive coverage to women who are about to lose it or never had it because of their employers’ religious objections.

headline.main: Obama Weighs Steps to Cover Contraception
headline.print_headline: Obama Weighs Steps to Cover Contraception

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
